title: Grade 8
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

85D1B88DB1A14619B5F37446D63725F4.description: Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases across contexts.

731F8B5DD08045608074025F3B242C6C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

E751946C36AD47DDBD5851D62DE488AE.description:
Use knowledge of common words to understand the meaning of compound and complex words in which they appear (e.g., birdhouse,
household).

1C77026C80E940008529D85966DC3A6F.description: Demonstrate understanding of the use of multiple meaning words.

C5E6334DC58844F3B22CA98264948304.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

4CEFDD1DA19242EA8A4A07795CC856F4.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

38BC6703381C4FE5B223634080DFBDF7.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings drawn from grade 8 content using context clues.

D8CA20E4D9A54C028D04FF913CD6BE93.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

87583ACC7613408DBA31828D8DBFC774.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating by using a range of verb tenses (e.g., I walked, I walk, I will walk) accurately
when writing or communicating.

8B4A3A51CE6B4CCEB25157C9D7AD04A1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

869221FC4D444859B2766F7F26DB842C.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English within 6-8 conventions continuum when writing.

4D9B9E1C821140D99E453C31E00FC96D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

9B66B9C63CE9417A8F2EDAB3824F7B4C.description: Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage within the 6-8 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

CD2067B2B7024A0D953AA3AE574F5085.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

915BD2A95A0449888611478327954F0C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

060D1D114E784A50850F379F05B4EAA6.description: Include multimedia and visual information into presentations.

6747F702B9A545EE933798132D26DAB1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

D2A7D33E10694E37A831E603FC13C61C.description: Communicate findings including relevant descriptions, facts, or details.

8647A2E9A63B4F668B4BE271617F5CBF.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

9ADADF98ABB7484C96A736F4FA92BA48.description: Determine the argument made by a speaker on a topic.

39199309BAF94588B458FD9EADD3DF79.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

DFC5C47E314D48298A52A68E459BB320.description: Determine the purpose of information presented in graphic, oral, visual, or multimodal formats.

B974AE5FD977466394EBE47C2523ED3A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

A3465B72E0A5490AA48C5FA1FA519EC9.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others in a discussion and relate it to own ideas.

697834350D1A48AAB8062A4407725896.description: Remain on the topic of the discussion when asking or answering questions or making other contributions to a discussion.

52CD62297150441080ADAD19ADD5ADDB.description: Follow simple rules and carry out assigned roles during discussions.

EF741DD7ACE24118BF49DFABD2D83838.description: Come to discussions prepared to share information previously studied.

5CF166CCBF434B1E82955B81B15D1316.description: Communicate with others in group interactions.

139E8DF7A2DD405FA0C17BF8BD808490.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

20F5FB0BC997474291756ADB367334E2.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

1C2CE39A3D8845C29695DA28A39CED4C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

0CCFF4EC472B41F1AF0C77E5B2B35C7F.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

C480895C5A104EC58D732E0653D35DB6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

C0671EE86A414504A30369AB1F49D779.description: Select quotes providing relevant information about a topic from multiple print or digital sources.

15B944BBBCFE4FDBA8769769C90FBF2D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

64552742902E4B9193759804D5866BB4.description: Conduct short research projects to answer and pose questions based on multiple sources of information.

0AADA7C7C36C4515994734BA1888B36B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation

A404F308CEC14DDFBA3641D4F564E757.description: Use digital tools to produce writing to interact and collaborate with others.

FDCA6D98956544698C3AE7EDB5DC5A5F.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

3BCC564D4B9641EAA5191C546945BD45.description: Use words that describe the feelings of characters or provide other sensory information about the setting, experiences, or events.

32C6F273B1054CD98A82908F7385ADED.description: Use temporal words (e.g., first, then, next) to signal order.

E66A4C8F07FE4212A358222D2F8BD9E0.description: Write a narrative about a real or imagined experience introducing the experience, at least one character, and two or more events.

1E7E35EC057049B9976E419FD07AC131.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

7F2F4D3906244613906BDE5D7CFA2933.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

F052A714BC8544BCB3A747A84957C62D.description: Use domain specific vocabulary related to the topic.

EAB76CB6E5944A5B88AE3E9CF5CEBD82.description: Write one or more facts or details related to the topic.

DBCAE946CA3A4A11BFE54DD9A7BAE69D.description: Introduce a topic clearly and write to convey ideas and information about it including visual, tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate.

8D4A8FF888014EF2B6C095529E78CBFF.description: Write to share information supported by details.

9449837A59044271996043B611BBBD46.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

E0AB75E72AE04CB6B5B8153189F8767D.description: Use temporal words (first, next, also) to create connections.

60770338D0D14F70AFA5204032E10A80.description: Write reasons to support a claim about a topic or text.

A6AE4AB82EAD4598A07B23C8C74D2B9B.description: State the claim and provide reasons or pieces of evidence to support it.

CC6DBFECA00B4A94A74F1357EB756EFA.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

578A5FB9BC1D4836ACA382C7A15CCF0D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

E0E8C0C9110F417C97F80015FBD0E660.description:
Actively engage in reading of information text for sustained periods of time for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to
text.

F9ADCD5AD66E49CE99D6710EFB3F16B3.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

66918081F41E4E3794DB643653361124.description: Identify ways that two authors writing about the same topic disagree or present conflicting information."

E0A0488D205F4A5BA1879DAC7BEA6B3E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

1D6B22F49B734231A2919FBC7DC934D7.description: Identify the argument in a text and claims that support it.

4CA6B42712F24815AD11735ABE346B76.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

00E9E44840F14587B9FB899710289D69.description: Determine whether a topic is best presented as audio, video, multimedia, or text.

5EF3292D56674A5A9129A2F7E95987BC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

7326C670BADC4C7A9F4F1488B161A852.description: Determine an author’s purpose or point of view and identify examples from text that describe or support it.

056A0F8F22124EBB86DF627F3BDEE80F.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

F89F476829F0425AB26384789B3C8032.description: Locate the topic sentence and supporting details in a paragraph.

3F265ABDD02D4B6EBC464FAE344958A9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

4659D02A547C49049A694945A6C201A3.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text; determine how different word choices would change the meaning.

17D52D0FAD094624AA4817F20AF4853B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

489B8E25F8F54EF381E43523ABD39781.description: Sequence events in the order they were presented in the text.

2CDEC12EEE5C48188AE1640E2E374CC8.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

EF8BCA0394734F52902A4F9EA58DD41B.description: Determine the theme or central idea of a text and select details that relate to it.

1D8ABB05F64741E8A5D6314398B52F57.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

F58F10CB5E13417B9BAB84A244BDE189.description: Cite text to support inferences from informational text.

A8BE5BEDB58F4EAD9474B61FCAF1F639.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

96AE131C84AF4501BBEC7616FF461026.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time."

305F61158BDC45EEB2A42AE333B4EA75.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

43E0F65D14BA420EB2264660F385D97C.description: Compare themes, patterns of events, and characters across two or more stories or dramas.

E85FF1F859624F3181618B4B2CD56244.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

6DDAD47C9D3F46DE8ACD6720C7286F91.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

3843FB0FC0F749BFA530CA153BE6E7F7.description: Compare a text version of a story or drama with a video or live version of the same text.

67254CF251684723B9CA4220FA9DCE9A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

877B1EE5C05B4DBB975F6253238C4F1D.description: Determine the difference in the points of view of a character and the audience or reader in a text with suspense or humor.

78EED0E8EF3E4BF186A34F1ED81A91D3.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

982CC3EDE90040B1BDEF237718E2C6C7.description: Compare the structure of two or more texts.

2A648B87F1AF4692A259FB628EE6B28A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

8C73CFE389324103A4C29B7005E20CBA.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text; determine how different word choices would change the meaning"

0442126B6A6244AC8FD904C02999D44C.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

A9FEA2DF4E744ED1B98FE87B84CDBD5D.description: Identify which incidents in a story or drama lead to subsequent action.

ABFAADFD1B384BD6B99FB6C2834B5C2B.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

DB24A981E8A34E448C172E5EF11F9347.description: Recount an event related to the theme, including details about character and setting.

2BAED0EF0EEF40BBB28213032351BC72.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

960534CAC2A2475BA6DFCFF74E86BD21.description: Cite text to support inferences from stories and poems.

DB6E96EE4AAB4A43A7F89A2E078838C5.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
